title: Logical negation
content: This section makes our first use of the third axiom of propositional calculus, ~ ax-3 . It introduces logical negation.

blocks.name: con4
blocks.content: Alias for ~ ax-3 to be used instead of it for labeling consistency. Its associated inference is ~ con4i and its associated deduction is ~ con4d . (Contributed by BJ, 24-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: con4i
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ con4 . Its associated inference is ~ mt4 . Remark: this can also be proved using ~ notnot followed by ~ nsyl2 , giving a shorter proof but depending on more axioms (namely, ~ ax-1 and ~ ax-2 ). (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.)

blocks.name: con4d
blocks.content: Deduction associated with ~ con4 . (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: mt4
blocks.content: The rule of modus tollens. Inference associated with ~ con4i . (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 12-May-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.21i
blocks.content: A contradiction implies anything. Inference associated with ~ pm2.21 . Its associated inference is ~ pm2.24ii . (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-1993.)

blocks.name: pm2.24ii
blocks.content: A contradiction implies anything. Inference associated with ~ pm2.21i and ~ pm2.24i . (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2008.)

blocks.name: pm2.21d
blocks.content: A contradiction implies anything. Deduction associated with ~ pm2.21 . (Contributed by NM, 10-Feb-1996.)

blocks.name: pm2.21ddALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ pm2.21dd . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2017.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: pm2.21
blocks.content: From a wff and its negation, anything follows. Theorem *2.21 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 104. Also called the Duns Scotus law. Its commuted form is ~ pm2.24 and its associated inference is ~ pm2.21i . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 14-Sep-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.24
blocks.content: Theorem *2.24 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 104. Its associated inference is ~ pm2.24i . Commuted form of ~ pm2.21 . (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.)

blocks.name: jarl
blocks.content: Elimination of a nested antecedent. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 10-May-2013.)

blocks.name: jarli
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ jarl . Partial converse of ~ ja (the other partial converse being ~ jarri ). (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 4-Oct-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.18
blocks.content: Clavius's law, or "consequentia mirabilis" ("admirable consequence"). If a formula is implied by its negation, then it is true. Can be used in proofs by contradiction. Theorem *2.18 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 103. See also the weak Clavius law ~ pm2.01 . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.)

blocks.name: pm2.18i
blocks.content: Inference associated with the Clavius law ~ pm2.18 . (Contributed by BJ, 30-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: pm2.18d
blocks.content: Deduction form of the Clavius law ~ pm2.18 . (Contributed by FL, 12-Jul-2009.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 7-May-2011.)

blocks.name: notnotr
blocks.content: Double negation elimination. Converse of ~ notnot and one implication of ~ notnotb . Theorem *2.14 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 102. This was the fifth axiom of Frege, specifically Proposition 31 of [Frege1879] p. 44. In classical logic (our logic) this is always true. In intuitionistic logic this is not always true, and formulas for which it is true are called "stable". (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by David Harvey, 5-Sep-1999.) (Proof shortened by Josh Purinton, 29-Dec-2000.)

blocks.name: notnotri
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ notnotr . For a shorter proof using ~ ax-2 , see ~ notnotriALT . (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 15-Jul-2021.) Remove dependency on ~ ax-2 . (Revised by Steven Nguyen, 27-Dec-2022.)

blocks.name: notnotriALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ notnotri . Inference associated with ~ notnotr . Remark: the proof via ~ notnotr and ~ ax-mp also has three essential steps, but has a total number of steps equal to 8, instead of the present 7, because it has to construct the formula ` ph ` twice and the formula ` -. -. ph ` once, whereas the present proof has to construct the formula ` ph ` twice and the formula ` -. ph ` once, and therefore makes only one use of ~ wn instead of two. This can be checked by running the Metamath command "MM> SHOW PROOF notnotri / NORMAL". (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 15-Jul-2021.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: notnotrd
blocks.content: Deduction associated with ~ notnotr and ~ notnotri . Double negation elimination rule. A translation of the natural deduction rule ` -. -. ` C , ` _G |- -. -. ps => _G |- ps ` ; see ~ natded . This is Definition NNC in [Pfenning] p. 17. This rule is valid in classical logic (our logic), but not in intuitionistic logic. (Contributed by DAW, 8-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: con2d
blocks.content: A contraposition deduction. (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: con2
blocks.content: Contraposition. Theorem *2.03 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 100. (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 12-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: mt2d
blocks.content: Modus tollens deduction. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jul-1994.)

blocks.name: mt2i
blocks.content: Modus tollens inference. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1995.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 15-Sep-2012.)

blocks.name: nsyl3
blocks.content: A negated syllogism inference. (Contributed by NM, 1-Dec-1995.)

blocks.name: con2i
blocks.content: A contraposition inference. Its associated inference is ~ mt2 . (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Mel L. O'Cat, 28-Nov-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: nsyl
blocks.content: A negated syllogism inference. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: notnot
blocks.content: Double negation introduction. Converse of ~ notnotr and one implication of ~ notnotb . Theorem *2.12 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 101. This was the sixth axiom of Frege, specifically Proposition 41 of [Frege1879] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 28-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 2-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: notnoti
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ notnot . (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2008.)

blocks.name: notnotd
blocks.content: Deduction associated with ~ notnot and ~ notnoti . (Contributed by Jarvin Udandy, 2-Sep-2016.) Avoid biconditional. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 27-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: con1d
blocks.content: A contraposition deduction. (Contributed by NM, 27-Dec-1992.)

blocks.name: mt3d
blocks.content: Modus tollens deduction. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: mt3i
blocks.content: Modus tollens inference. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-1995.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 15-Sep-2012.)

blocks.name: nsyl2
blocks.content: A negated syllogism inference. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: con1
blocks.content: Contraposition. Theorem *2.15 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 102. Its associated inference is ~ con1i . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 12-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: con1i
blocks.content: A contraposition inference. Inference associated with ~ con1 . Its associated inference is ~ mt3 . (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Mel L. O'Cat, 28-Nov-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 19-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.24i
blocks.content: Inference associated with ~ pm2.24 . Its associated inference is ~ pm2.24ii . (Contributed by NM, 20-Aug-2001.)

blocks.name: pm2.24d
blocks.content: Deduction form of ~ pm2.24 . (Contributed by NM, 30-Jan-2006.)

blocks.name: con3d
blocks.content: A contraposition deduction. Deduction form of ~ con3 . (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.)

blocks.name: con3
blocks.content: Contraposition. Theorem *2.16 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 103. This was the fourth axiom of Frege, specifically Proposition 28 of [Frege1879] p. 43. Its associated inference is ~ con3i . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: con3i
blocks.content: A contraposition inference. Inference associated with ~ con3 . Its associated inference is ~ mto . (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 20-Jun-2013.)

blocks.name: con3rr3
blocks.content: Rotate through consequent right. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 3-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: mt4d
blocks.content: Modus tollens deduction. Deduction form of ~ mt4 . (Contributed by NM, 9-Jun-2006.)

blocks.name: mt4i
blocks.content: Modus tollens inference. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 12-May-2013.)

blocks.name: nsyld
blocks.content: A negated syllogism deduction. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-2005.)

blocks.name: nsyli
blocks.content: A negated syllogism inference. (Contributed by NM, 3-May-1994.)

blocks.name: nsyl4
blocks.content: A negated syllogism inference. (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-1996.)

blocks.name: pm3.2im
blocks.content: Theorem *3.2 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 111, expressed with primitive connectives (see ~ pm3.2 ). (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Josh Purinton, 29-Dec-2000.)

blocks.name: mth8
blocks.content: Theorem 8 of [Margaris] p. 60. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Josh Purinton, 29-Dec-2000.)

blocks.name: jc
blocks.content: Deduction joining the consequents of two premises. A deduction associated with ~ pm3.2im . (Contributed by NM, 28-Dec-1992.)

blocks.name: impi
blocks.content: An importation inference. (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 20-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: expi
blocks.content: An exportation inference. (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Mel L. O'Cat, 28-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: simprim
blocks.content: Simplification. Similar to Theorem *3.27 (Simp) of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 112. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Nov-2012.)

blocks.name: simplim
blocks.content: Simplification. Similar to Theorem *3.26 (Simp) of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 112. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 21-Jul-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.5
blocks.content: Theorem *2.5 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 9-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.51
blocks.content: Theorem *2.51 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.)

blocks.name: pm2.521
blocks.content: Theorem *2.521 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.52
blocks.content: Theorem *2.52 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: expt
blocks.content: Exportation theorem ~ ex expressed with primitive connectives. (Contributed by NM, 28-Dec-1992.)

blocks.name: impt
blocks.content: Importation theorem ~ imp expressed with primitive connectives. (Contributed by NM, 25-Apr-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 20-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.61d
blocks.content: Deduction eliminating an antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 12-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.61d1
blocks.content: Inference eliminating an antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-2005.)

blocks.name: pm2.61d2
blocks.content: Inference eliminating an antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: ja
blocks.content: Inference joining the antecedents of two premises. For partial converses, see ~ jarri and ~ jarli . (Contributed by NM, 24-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Mel L. O'Cat, 19-Feb-2008.)

blocks.name: jad
blocks.content: Deduction form of ~ ja . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 13-Dec-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 17-Sep-2011.)

blocks.name: pm2.61i
blocks.content: Inference eliminating an antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 12-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.61ii
blocks.content: Inference eliminating two antecedents. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Josh Purinton, 29-Dec-2000.)

blocks.name: pm2.61nii
blocks.content: Inference eliminating two antecedents. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jul-2005.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 13-Nov-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.61iii
blocks.content: Inference eliminating three antecedents. (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2002.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 22-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.01
blocks.content: Weak Clavius law. If a formula implies its negation, then it is false. A form of "reductio ad absurdum", which can be used in proofs by contradiction. Theorem *2.01 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 100. Provable in minimal calculus, contrary to the Clavius law ~ pm2.18 . (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Mel L. O'Cat, 21-Nov-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 31-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: pm2.01d
blocks.content: Deduction based on reductio ad absurdum. (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 5-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.6
blocks.content: Theorem *2.6 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2005.)

blocks.name: pm2.61
blocks.content: Theorem *2.61 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. Useful for eliminating an antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 22-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.65
blocks.content: Theorem *2.65 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 107. Proof by contradiction. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.65i
blocks.content: Inference for proof by contradiction. (Contributed by NM, 18-May-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: pm2.21dd
blocks.content: A contradiction implies anything. Deduction from ~ pm2.21 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2017.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 22-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: pm2.65d
blocks.content: Deduction for proof by contradiction. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 26-May-2013.)

blocks.name: mto
blocks.content: The rule of modus tollens. The rule says, "if ` ps ` is not true, and ` ph ` implies ` ps ` , then ` ph ` must also be not true". Modus tollens is short for "modus tollendo tollens", a Latin phrase that means "the mode that by denying denies" - remark in [Sanford] p. 39. It is also called denying the consequent. Modus tollens is closely related to modus ponens ~ ax-mp . Note that this rule is also valid in intuitionistic logic. Inference associated with ~ con3i . (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: mtod
blocks.content: Modus tollens deduction. (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: mtoi
blocks.content: Modus tollens inference. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jul-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 15-Sep-2012.)

blocks.name: mt2
blocks.content: A rule similar to modus tollens. Inference associated with ~ con2i . (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 10-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: mt3
blocks.content: A rule similar to modus tollens. Inference associated with ~ con1i . (Contributed by NM, 18-May-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: peirce
blocks.content: Peirce's axiom. A non-intuitionistic implication-only statement. Added to intuitionistic (implicational) propositional calculus, it gives classical (implicational) propositional calculus. For another non-intuitionistic positive statement, see ~ curryax . (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-1992.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 9-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: looinv
blocks.content: The Inversion Axiom of the infinite-valued sentential logic (L-infinity) of Lukasiewicz. Using ~ dfor2 , we can see that this essentially expresses "disjunction commutes". Theorem *2.69 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 108. It is a special instance of the axiom "Roll", see ~ peirceroll . (Contributed by NM, 12-Aug-2004.)

blocks.name: bijust0
blocks.content: A self-implication (see ~ id ) does not imply its own negation. The justification theorem ~ bijust is one of its instances. (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.) (Proof shortened by Josh Purinton, 29-Dec-2000.) Extract ~ bijust0 from proof of ~ bijust . (Revised by BJ, 19-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: bijust
blocks.content: Theorem used to justify the definition of the biconditional ~ df-bi . Instance of ~ bijust0 . (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1999.)
